results.title: Crash Zone: Undercover
results.creator_credit: Patricia Edgar, Esben Storm, Philip Dalkin, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Alex’s valuable necklace goes missing at Catalyst and everyone is a suspect. Pi feels particularly that she needs to prove her innocence although Virgil’s idea of helping by downloading Detective Stories from the Net is making things more difficult. When Marcello’s little sister Sam is lost on the streets, the kids have two demanding cases on their hands.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Peach's Australia: Arnhem Land
results.creator_credit: Stanley Moore, Bill Peach, David Roberts and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Popular former ABC TV personality Bill Peach travels the length and breadth of Australia seeking out often little known facets of the country’s history and their relation to present day conditions in the particular areas.
In this episode, Bill Peach explores Arnhem Land and it’s history, as seen by the Aboriginal people who live there. The program was filmed at the Gove, Elcho Island, Deaf Adder Gorge, Murganella and other places within the Kakadu National Park and includes a visit to the oldest rock paintings in Australia.

results.title: World Series Cricket : C'mon Aussie c'mon [advertisement]
results.brief_description:
An advertisement for the first season of World Series Cricket featuring the now famous song ‘C’mon Aussie c’mon’ originally performed by the Mojo Singers.
Produced by Mojo MDA.

results.title: Aboriginal bark painting (A)
results.creator_credit: Latrobe University. School of Education. Media Centre
results.brief_description: Made in partnership with the Barinaga Aboriginal Co-operative at Maningrida, Northern Territory. Provides an informative look at the bark paintings of Arnhem Land, placing the art work firmly in the context of Aboriginal belief systems and using traditional techniques. A useful complement to “The art and craft of Maningrida”. Narrated by Robin Cuming.

results.title: Wildlife of the River Valley
results.brief_description: A program that presents a unique view of the enormous variety of wildlife that lives in the Bellinger River Valley, situated halfway between Sydney and Brisbane on the east coast of Australia. This is a brightly paced, entertaining and informative documentary that can be enjoyed by audiences of all ages.

results.title: Les Murray
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
Filmed at his home, a poetry reading and on his family’s farm in Northern NSW, Les Murray shares his love for poetry in this colourful and engaging portrait.

results.title: MIMA Yearbook. Vol. 2
results.brief_description: Volume two of a three volume set, this video compilation of excerpts of Australian film and video art covers the period from 1980-1983, and is a unique and tantalising entry into non-mainstream history of Australian film and video.

results.title: Image makers (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ursula Kolbe and Institute of Early Childhood Studies (Waverley, N.S.W.)
results.brief_description:
Looks at the way children make images and how this helps them explore and cope with the world at large, giving it order and meaning.

Includes footage from the Murawina Aboriginal Education Centre in Redfern, Sydney.
